description.narrative: (Rwanda): Through the Ubaka Ejo (Build the Future) activity, USAID aims to improve the wellbeing of orphans and vulnerable children (OVC) and their families in five districts, especially those affected by HIV/AIDS. With FY18 funds, Ubaka Ejo will implement community-based maternal and child health, nutrition and water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) interventions. FY18 funds will be used to reach a total of 55,000 children under five through growth monitoring and promotion, and to provide nutrition training to their caretakers, covering, the entire district of Rwamagana. Ubaka Ejo will also promote safe pregnancies by encouraging pregnant women to attend at least four antenatal care visits at health facilities, which will include nutrition counseling at health facilities and cooking demonstrations and improved feeding practices to increase weight gain for pregnant women. Ubaka Ejo will promote WASH practices, including small scale water spring construction, protection and management to ensure quality water supply and access to the most disadvantaged and hard to reach communities, promote hand washing practices at the household level and strategic populations meeting points, safe water use at the household level, and latrine cleanliness promotion to prevent diarrhea diseases that affect not only the health status of children but also interferes with nutrient absorption leading to malnutrition. ..Ubaka Ejo is implemented by Africa Evangelistic Enterprise (AEE), a local partner with proven expertise in improving the well being of orphans, vulnerable children and their families. Ubaka Ejo directly contributes to the Country Development Cooperation Strategy (CDCS) goal of improving the health and nutrition of Rwandans. ...
